answerText: James Weldon Johnson[10] In response to post-war violence against blacks, this Jamaican-American man wrote the poem "If we must die." He is better known for novels like Banana Bottom and Home to Harlem.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Wellesley + Hunter  | 19 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Name these authors associated with the Harlem Renaissance, for 10 points each. [10] This leading figure in the NAACP wrote a novel about a talented pianist who travels to Europe playing for a rich white cosmopolitan man before marrying a white woman, The Autobiography of an Ex-Colored Man.
